oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Beth Salem Presbyterian Church: program bulletin for the 1995 Homecoming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Beth Salem Presbyterian Church
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Beth Salem Presbyterian Church and Cemetery
TN 30 at Watson Rd, Athens, McMinn County, TN
Copy of a program from the 1995 Homecoming for Beth Salem

Beth Salem Presbyterian Church, organized in 1866, was the first African-American congregation established in the three-county area of Polk, McMinn, and Meigs. Its establishment is a significant example of the impact of white missionaries on Tennessee's religious institutions in the wake of the Civil War. The log church building also served as a public school for African Americans. The congregation used the initial log building until it was destroyed in a fire c. 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; African American cemeteries -- Tennessee
